com.dotsandboxes.imagepicker

Class ImagePickerFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.dotsandboxes.imagepicker.ImagePickerFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner

    public class ImagePickerFragment
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
    Created by agile-01 on 6/10/2016.

    get instance using newInstance(com.dotsandboxes.imagepicker.ImagePickerCallback, com.dotsandboxes.imagepicker.MarshMallowHelper)
    call captureImageFromCamera(androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity) for camera
    call selectImageFromGallery(androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity) for gallery

    Call processActivityResult(int, int, android.content.Intent, androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity)
    inside activity/fragment's Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, android.content.Intent) to get result bitmap from camera/gallery

    Call processPermissionResults(int, int[], androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity)
    inside activity/fragment's Activity.onRequestPermissionsResult(int, java.lang.String[], int[]) for marshmallow permissions

    Call removeCallbacks() on destroy of activity/fragment

    Never call Fragment.getActivity() / Fragment.getResources() directly inside this fragment
    since this fragment will never be attached to activity but to be accessed from another fragment.
    doing this will throw an IllegalStateException
